description.narrative: Previous grants to the Low Carbon Transition Unit (LCTU) of the Danish Energy Agency (DEA) expired end of June 2014. With the allocation from the Global Frame under the Climate Envelope 2014, DEAs further activities towards emerging economies are supported for the 2-year period from July 2014 to June 2016. The development objective of the support to the DEA is to assist developing countries with transition to low carbon economies and implementation of a new global climate agreement. The targeted outcome is that emerging economies - with focus on China, Mexico, RSA and Vietnam - are further enabled in reaching ambitious climate and energy goals through knowledge sharing and support within planning, regulation and implementation of energy efficiency and renewable energy policy in an Agency-to-Agency cooperation between Ministry of Climate, Energy and Building (MCEB)/DEA and corresponding climate and energy authorities. Specifically, DEA provides technical supervision and technical assistance to the 3 bilateral energy cooperation programmes in RSA, Vietnam and Mexico and technical assistance to China National Renewable Energy Centre. In addition, DEA is engaged in crosscutting work covering GHG-emissions baselines and mitigation potentials, policy toolkits, financing mechanisms and readiness of National Appropriate Mitigation Actions (NAMAs).
